page.title: 03BASSETLAW DIST.GEN. HOSPITAL
page.content: The Bassetlaw District General Hospital is planned to replace two hospital sites in the town. At present it employs approximately 700 staff and caters for the 100,000 population in the Northern third of the county. It comprises an old building (Kilton Hill) and a new one completed in 1983 at a cost of Â£7 million. Two further phases will complete the project. Phase one, from January 1986 to January 1989 will provide 112 beds for acute cases, 30 children's beds and eight baby beds. Phase two from September 1992 will provide newer facilities and equipment. The old accomodation will eventually be demolished.
